definition: The act or process of introducing or the state of being introduced.
A means, such as a personal letter, of presenting one person to another.
Something recently introduced; an innovation: “He loathed a fork; it is a modern introduction which has still scarcely reached common people” ( D.H. Lawrence )

Something spoken, written, or otherwise presented in beginning or introducing something, especially:
a. A preface, as to a book.
b. Music A short preliminary passage in a larger movement or work.
c. A basic introductory text or course of study.
The act or process of introducing.
A means, such as a personal letter, of presenting one person to another.
An initial section of a book or article, which introduces the subject material.
